transcript.content: White Stripes - Fell In Love With A Girl
White Stripes, 'Fell In Love With A Girl', on Xfm 104.9, well it's five past one of a Saturday.
That's true enough.
So, it's The Ricky Gervais Show, with me, Steve Merchant.
Hi!
Hi ya. Now listen...
Karl there...say his name!
Karl.
Karl Pilkington.
Okay, it's just getting a little bit annoying, cos they're writing it up now in Heat, and saying...
I know, saying...
It's sort of like, it's The Karl Pilkington Show with Ricky and Steve, so... let's, you know...
Has he won multiple awards?
Yeah, no.
I expect not.
Exactly, no.
Is he one of the hottest comedy faces on TV, I don't think so.
I don't think so. No... no... does he eat too much cheese...
Exactly.
...and get a bit sick.
Is he a bloated old fat forty year old.
Alright steady on.
With a stupid fat face.
You goggle-eyed freak...
Alright, there's no need for that.
You wurzel- oh you'll be happy.
Go on.
The Wurzels have made a bit of a comeback, there's...
Oh don't give me this...
No, listen, right, there's a Sainsbury's advert, and they sing a song, it's The Wuzels singing a song about something, phone in, what's the number Karl?
Phone in, if you know what I'm talking about.
Steve laughs.
Just in general! (Laughing) That's a new competition...!
Can we just repeat that number, every 30 seconds.
Ricky laughs.
And people can just explain what the last link would have been.
Phone in, if you know what we're talking about.
Yeah.
Yeah.
Phone in if you care what we're talking about.
Phone in, well...
What's The Wurzel story, what's the deal?
No I, no I just thought of you cos they sound like...
Thanks.
...and it's a song, a modern song I think they've done, and I can't remember what the song is, but maybe...
See... what you mean it's them doing a modern hit...
It's an advert, just an advert. I think it's The Wurzels. I thought of something as well, you know they go, (singing) “I drove my tractor passed your haystack last night, hm-hm-hm-hm.”
I'm not that familiar, surprisingly.
What sort of person lives in a haystack?
Pause.
Maybe they don't live in it, maybe they were just saying you that's 'your haystack'...
Well, yes, they're probably a farm owner.
Ricky giggles.

The problem with The Wurzels is, is like, you know, if you come from the West Country, you're just constantly cursed by this, “Oh you must love the Wurzels; do you like the Wurzels? Ooh argh!” and it's like, no-one...
Then why do you, why do you do your hair and your sideburns like 'em, if you don't like 'em.
Well, you know, smocks are very comfortable Rick.
Ricky laughs.
But you know I don't wanna be kind of, you know, tarred, there's lots of famous things that have come from Bristol, obviously Tricky and Massive Attack, Portishead from the area Portishead.
Yeah.
No-one seems to flag them up, every time they wanna slag off the West Country.
Do you still make your own clogs? Cos...
Yes I do!
That's fantastic.
Cheap.
You used to knit your trousers didn't you, when you, you, why was that, cos it was just like cheap material...
Straw is cheap... down there.
We've got a great show lined up for ya.
Have we?
Yeah...erm... I was bluffing, I don't know, I've got no idea.
Rick, you know we sometimes worry about the record library here at Xfm, cos we tend to go in and try to find something, it'll be like an old Smiths' classic.
Oh, Karl's sighing, cos he gets stick Monday morning.
But, it's very hard to find anything half-decent, I think most of it's been nicked by people like Sturgess, and otherwise it's just bad, I don't know who it is that's buying the CDs.
What was Four Non Blondes' big single?
Exactly, erm... (singing) “oh, oh, oh”, something like that.
Brilliant... excellent.
Steve laughs.
“Tonight Matthew, I'm gonna be Four Non Blondes.”Ricky and Steve: (singing) “Oh, oh, oh.”
“Good effort, I don't think you'll be returning to the fish factory on Monday, will you Steve...”, 'no', yeah you will, you will. Go on.
But they, anyway, so we go down there, Four Non Blondes, we found a lot of INXS, for the Xfm record library, guess what I found today Rick.
Go on.
'The Very Best of Tony Basil'.
Well, that's one track then.

Well, yeah, her hit was 'Mickey' obviously “oh Mickey, you're so fine.” They've managed to pack out 18, there's 18 tracks, first track's 'Mickey', number of other tracks, track number seventeen - 'Mickey (Spanish version)
Right.
Track 18, Mickey (12 inch version).
...and Track 19, 'Dicky', similar tune but about a completely different person altogether...
Look at this, they've stuck a proud 'property of Xfm' sticker on that, 'The Best of Tony Basil'.
Even Sturgess wouldn't nick that.
Come on Karl, what's the story?
It was good in its day weren't it?
Why is it in the Xfm library?
You were moaning last week about Adam and the Ants, in the day he was important weren't he, I remember that being out in the charts, it was alright.
Yes, I know...
Music's meant to be fun.
Fine...
Let's play...
...let's play 'Mickey'.
Let's play some Strokes then.
No, let's play 'Mickey' then, if you're so happy about this Karl, shall we play 'Mickey' later.
Yeah.
The Spanish version, what about that?
See, we've called your bluff.
Alright?
Alright, yeah...
Steve hoots.
Phone in if you know what he just said.
The Strokes - Last Night
Uh, that’s the Strokes, and uh, Last Night.  Um, we just had a call, didn’t we.  From uh, uh, Johnny Mango.
Oh yeah, Johnny Mango, yeah.
Yeah – the old - The Mangster. Um, and he informed me that one of the Wurzels is dead, and I didn’t know that.
Yeah, Adge Cutler, he was the lead man, I think.
Yeah.  Who’s – he said he died the most rock ‘n roll death you can die, he said he was apparently drivin’ on a terrible cocktail of cider and other things presumably,
Yeah.
Apples, and jams.  And uh, he crashed into a tractor!  No – wh – is that true?
Yeah.
I hope,  I hope JM’s not windin’ me up.
Yeah.
I hope the Mango boy’s not, havin’ a laugh at me.  Is that true.  One of the Wurzels died by tractor.
Steve laughs
Did he – is that true.  So, give us a call.  What’s the number again, Karl?
If so, I’m sorry.  I disrepected ‘im.  I didn’t, I didn’t know -
Imagine, if, right, say if like you’re the driver of the tractor,
Mm.
And you kill someone and you go, Oh God, I killed someone.  And you look and it’s someone famous.
Yeah.  Or Adge Cutler.
Ricky bursts out in laughter
Yeah, go on.  What was your point?
No, it’s just like,
Terrifying!
Not only, it’s like you’ve killed someone, then you look,
Yeah, I know what you mean, actually, that’s terrifying!
What makes it even worse, what makes it even worse, they were rich!
Yeah.
Oh, that’d really be ..
No, but say if it was someone like big in the world.
No, that is a good, I quite like that, that is an interesting point, that.
Oh that’s your bag.  No wonder I can’t find what I’m looking for.
Oh right, well –
As Bono said!
Did you bring a bag?
Yeah!  Sorry, I –
Is that it under there, Rick?
Sorry – sorry about this –
Can we play a record, this is getting a bit sloppy.
No, it’s not – nonono –
No, it IS, Rick it’s sloppy!
It’s never got sloppy before!  No, I’ve got a list here, ‘cause we went to um, this awards ceremony in the week.  Um, we were up for an award,
Well let me –I have to explain it to Karl.  Basically we were up for an award, and it’s the, it’s the TRIC Awards.  Now TRIC stands for uh, “Television and Radio Industries” annual awards, right,
We’d never heard of it either.
We’d never heard of it – it’s some kind of, like television/radio industry club.
Ricky laughs
Yeah, that’s the clue!
So um, we don’t wanna – I’m not tryin’ to slag off people,
No!

There was some big names and they really made an effort, and it was really nice, the food was brilliant, it was at the Grosvenor House Hotel, really nice do, and lots of industry people there, and it was really classy,
We got there nice and early, so, you know, we were there for a good 4 hours.  It was fun.

Before we had to sit down.  And, but it was just kind of surreal, it was just a big weird, ‘cause it was packed with the cream, literally the cream, big names, you know, Martin Kemp, one of the first people I saw, you know. Came in, big TV/radio industry names, on-screen talent, behind-the-scenes people,
John Barnes,
Barnes was there,
Beadle was there,
Sir Cliff Richard was there,
Yeah,
Right ? Anyway, so the voice comes on says, Ladies and gentlemen, please welcome the chairman,
The president –

The president of the, the TRIC Awards, and we had to stand up, all these people had to stand up, and give a standing ovation, as he walked to his table, to Tom O’Conner, former presenter of Crosswits.
You are joking.
No.
He’s the president.

And he came out and he told a few gags.  Sorta like, it was like, straight away, it was, you know, old school stuff.  I want to thank the ladies, ‘cause the, you know, it’s nothin’ without the ladies.  All the lovely ladies here.  And we’re waitin’ for a joke …. nope.  Just thankin’, thankin’ the ladies.
Steve chuckles
Well you’re forgettin’ that just prior to that, he uh, he said grace.
Oh, he said grace!
Before we ate.

Right, it’s me, it was me, Steve, and Ash, our producer, you know the little, um, disabled fella, all right, and he’s, he’s there, in his wheelchair, and there’s me and Steve, we’re, we’re standin’ up, during grace,
By the way, can I just stop you there.
Go on.
Saw someone in the week, and, um,
Sorry, did we bore you?
Ricky laughs
No – you just reminded me, then about the little producer,  who was in the wheelchair,
Yeah.  Yeah.
Last week you said, Blah blah blah, and our producer who’s in a wheelchair, got a text from someone sayin’ What’s happened to you?  They thought you were talkin’ ‘bout me.
Oh, really!
Oh!
Oh!
You’re – you’re handicapped in a different way.
So go on.
And uh, Tom O’Conner, he said, uh, Uh, Thank you, God, for,
We thought this was a joke, initially, we thought it was going to be like a kind of cheeky gag,
That’s why we were laughing out loud.
That’s why we were laughing raucously.
Ricky laughs

But anyway, then he went, Oh, thank you God for this, and, uh, and help those, who walk alone.  And Ash went, What about those that don’t walk at all?  He said, I’ve never been, I’ve never been left out of grace before!
Ricky giggles
So we had to, I know we like bowed our heads slightly, and did we say Amen?  I know we were sort of, a lot of people did,
I’m pretty sure,
Cliff, probably, chimed in there,
Yeah.  He sang it.
And uh, exactly.  So um,
Like Mariah Carey.

So anyway, again, you see, what Ricky’s forgetten is, before Tom took to the stage, this guy walks up there, I don’t know who he is, says, There’s a lot of people here this afternoon, you know, it’s a wonderful event, but of course, there’s a load of celebrities as well.
He said, Thank you for all the celebrities that have turned up.  And then he went, (picks up paper) Table 77, Mr Russ Abbott.
Ricky claps
Round of applause.  Can we have the spotlight there?
Russ Abbott, by the way, smoking a pipe.  He looked like um, a bit like, uh, Barrett Holmes.  The hilarious Sherlock Holmes character.
Then he went, Table 107, the cast of Bad Girls.  Clap.
Ricky claps
We all had to clap.
Then he went, Table 5, Alice Beer.  Clap.
Slightly smaller clapping.
Yeah, yeah.  And it’s, it’s just like, and I thought, when is this gonna –
He went through every single celebrity in the room.
And there were about, you know, 100.
Table 53, John Inman, everyone!  It’s John Inman! Round of applause.
Steve claps
Yeah, yeah.  Uh, Table 70, Mr Simon Cowell.
Ricky boos
Yeah, there was booing there.
And they all booed him!
That was nice.
Yeah, it was a joke, ironic booing, I think.
Did they cheer for Foxy.  Was he on a table.
We didn’t see Foxy.
Foxy wasn’t there.  He was doin’ his show.  When they went up, he won an award, Cowell and, uh, Waterman, and Chapman,

Table 43, Peter Sissons, everyone.  Peter Sissons.  Went through every single name, Ricky got so paranoid they might mention him that we, we kind of legged it upstairs and were watching from the balcony as they shone the spot light on our table,
Empty chairs!
And it was empty,
Ricky laughs

That was particularly fun.  But uh, then in the end, Sir Cliff got up there, right, ‘cause Sir Cliff was giving out the um, the lifetime achievement award.  Right, he gets up and goes Dadada, this is a personal friend of mine, a 7-days-a-week friend.  Lifetime achievement award goes to, Mrs Gloria Hunniford.  Right, we immediately start thinking what exactly were her lifetime achievements.
I think living that long.
That’s pretty much it.  I don’t know what it is she’s done.
I can tell you what she does
I know she does, Radio 2 or everything like that,
We’re not dissing her, we’re not dissing anyone!
No!  Good luck to her.
We’re not taking the mick out of anyone,
But anyway, she’s,
It was a strange, it was a strange event!

But Gloria got taken unawares by this, and started to ad-lib a speech.  Right, and I swear to God, about 12 minutes in, she was telling us how, and I can tell you now if you’re interested, her lovely daughter Karen, is currently in Australia, it’s partly work it’s partly a holiday, Karl, and she’s havin’ a whale of a time.  But she’s not spoken to her for ages!
And then she went, she went, Actually she’s been there for a long time,
Yeah, she’s –
And it’slike (mumbles) go, She doesn’t call,
Yeah!
You do that, you get on Blue Peter, and this is how she –
Ricky fake cries
We thought she was gonna get photos out, maybe, start showin’ it – it was just, bizarre.
No, it was, it was a nice event, and uh, everyone there, Henry Cooper was there,
It was good because every single element as well was sponsored by someone,
Yeah.
I was lookin’ at the menu, I’ve got the programme here, and the menu, right, pudding, is sponsored by Electrolux.
Yeah.
Steve laughs
I mean, I don’t know if you’ve ever had a pudding sponsored by,
Yeah
Electrolux,
I was sponsored by Zanussi.
When everyone was doin’ the prayers, did you, did you look at ‘em with their eyes shut.  Like, like you did at school.
Ricky sniggers
What do you mean.
Well, wh – when you had to -
Did you look at someone with your eyes shut.
No, you do that.  You do your um, your hands together,
Yeah.
You sort of look at people with their eyes shut, and think that’s what they look like they’re sleeping.
Play a record.
Steve laughs
Didn’t you ever do that?
Cornershop - Lessons Learned From Rocky
Table 60, Liza Tarbuck.
Steve hahas
That uh, Cornershop, Lessons Learned from Rocky – I love that guitar.
Mm.

That’s great.  That’s real glam rock, T Rex and Bowie, I was gonna play summat from uh, Ziggy Stardust today, but instead I brought in a different album.  I’m gonna play a bit a’ Bowie, is that all right?
Mm, of course.  Always.  Yeah.
Bit a’ Beatles.  Still to come up, by the way, we um, the um, with the Education of Karl, last week he did Che Guevara,
Very good.  Yeah.
He did very well.  Before that, the week before that, he learned all about Rasputin, didn’t ya.
And, this week you’ve been studying Hitler, haven’t you.
(grunts)
How did that go, how’d you (mumbles)
It’s a bit tough.
Ok.
Um, I’ll give you the full story later, Steve.  Do you know much about him?
No.
‘Sum, they’re all linked.  All these stories I’ve been reading.  They’ve all got a similar sort of thing going through ‘em.
Right.
They’re born, they have a bit of a tough upbringing,
Mmhm.
Things aren’t going well, and they seem to take it out on, on other people.
Ok.
But I’ll tell you more later.
Ok.
Yeah, I don’t think you can, I mean, I don’t think Hitler and Che Guevara –
It’s the same thing!  Che Guevara, when he was a kid,
Yeah,
Had like, asthma.
Yeah.
All right?  He wasn’t an happy kid.  Uh, Hitler, um, he um,
He only had one ball.
Right!
Well, I was tryin’ to find about that,

Ye—seriously, he phoned me up in the week, I said, How’s it going, he went, I’ve skimmed it.  I’ve just skimmed it.  I was looking for the uh, the testicle thing.  Now I don’t know if they left that out, or it’s not true.
Right.
So he was, he was trying to look up that Hitler has only got one ball.
I think they only did it to wind him up.
Ricky titters
Because it’s like, yeah, you might be takin’ over the world, but we’re all sayin’ you’ve only got one testicle.
Sure.  So did you, did you look in the index and it’s sort of Hitler, Adolph,  Family Life, Early Childhood, Testicles.  Testicles (Absence Of).
Sort of skimmed through, because,
One of!
Yeah.
Mother – brackets Other.
Yeah, yeah.
Yeah.  Albert Hall!
Yeah.

The only thing I could find was at one point, in, in, like, when he was tryin’ to run the place, was like there was a meeting going on, and somebody had put a bag in a, in the meeting room, and it blew up.
Yeah, and the table -
And I wonder it if was under the table.
What, you’re wondering if it blew a testicle off?
It wasn’t, it wasn’t, what, the testicle was under the table?
No, the bag – the bag blew off the ball.
No, the ball sack was probably hanging below the uh, protective top.  And so, that’s where he could’ve lost –
But why would he’ve only just lost the one?
Uh, because the,
The way he was sittin’.
Ricky laughs

Cross-legged or something.  Sure.  Sure, Ok.  Well, I mean, again, again, last week we had a Che Guevara expert phoned up, maybe there’s a Hitler expert  this time who can maybe phone up and confirm the uh, the testicle theory.
Yeah.  Yeah.
What’s the number again, Karl?
You need to at least have a PhD or something.
I don’t – I don’t think we should invite calls about Hitler.  I think we’re asking for trouble.
No.
No, I think someone who’s done a study of him and  who’s done a PhD.
Ok.  All right.
I’m not talking about any old nutter.
And also um, uh, Karl’s lottery numbers.  He’s a little bit more confident this week.
Ok, good.
He went, he went, they’re more like it, and I looked at ‘em and I laughed, he went, No, no, even Suzanne said I’m on the – more on the right lines there.
Steve titters

Is there, is anyone who um, uh, has done a degree in Maths or A level Maths, that can bear, Karl won’t believe this, right.  Karl thinks, I was tryin’ to, I know I was partly doin’ this to confuse him, just to see that look on his face, like a cat.  All right?  But, there is, the chances, with random numbers, for example, the lottery, of gettin’ 1-2-3-4-5-6, are not greater than any other, single combination.
Right.

Now that’s true.  I don’t mean you’re more likely to get 1-2-3-4-5-6 than any other combination put together, but than any other individual combination, they’re all equal.  It’s counter-intuitive, I know, I know you think that to get a run of 1 to 6, is less likely than anything else, but it’s not.  Uh, any names,
It is.
It’s not, Karl.  If there’s a, a probability,
It’s never happened.  It’s never happened.
Yeah, but there’s any number of combinations that
Never happened.

Every one of to those combinations that have come up, have happened, and they’re just as likely, or unlikely, as any other combination.  Right?  It’s just that you feel, intuitively, right, that 1-2-3-4-5-6 is less likely than 1-7 -12 -34 - 60 – you know what I mean?
Well, I didn’t win.
Ricky laughs
Play a record.
Ok.
Red Hot Chili Peppers - Under the Bridge
Wu-Tang Clan - Uzi
Wu-Tang Clan.  Uzi.  On Xfm 104.9.  Well, here we are, the day before St Patrick’s day.
Oh, hooray!  Brilliant!
Guiness.  Etc.

I hate people, I hate British – English people, I should say, who are obsessed with celebrating St Patrick’s Day.  You know, all crazy, like Chris Evans used to rave on about it – We’re going to Dublin!  We’re gonna get drunk!  Waaah. It’s like, it means nothing to me.
I think Xfm used to do that, to be honest.
Well, yeah.  Exactly.  Just as bad.
Careful.  Careful.  They are our employers.  You don’t wanna – you don’t wanna annoy ‘em.  What would we do without this?
Steve sniggers
That’s true.
All right?
Have an enjoyable Saturday.
No!  This is my favourite 2 hours!  You enjoy this, don’t ya?
Well, I dunno…
We can’t do this through May and June!
No, we’ll be gone.
We’ve gotta be – we gotta record the 2nd series of The Office.  What we you gonna do, Karl.  What are you gonna do on a Saturday.
Host the show yourself?
Do it on me own.
You are not!
Are you seriously thinkin’ of it.  Have they asked you to do it?
We’ve made you everything that you’re –
Why, why would you not think about it.
‘Cause I’ve been there, done that.
Ricky and Steve laugh
Next challenge, please!
Oh, dear.  D’you know uh, d’you know uh, what St Patrick did?  Why he was revered as a saint and everything?  What was he famous for in Ireland.  He did – he rid Ireland of something.
I don’t know, but I’ll bet he started off with something odd, happening in his life.
Ricky laughs
What you think he had asthma or something, as a kid.
They all – they all do.
And he took it out on what, then?
What did he – exactly.  He took it out on something.  What did he do.  What did he rid Ireland of.
Uhhh….
St Patrick.
St Patrick.
This is why we’re gonna get crazy and drunk tomorrow, this is why we’re all so happy to celebrate his uh, anniversary, or whatever it is we’re celebratin’.  This is why we –
That’s why we have a craic,

Yeah.  This is why we don’t bother to celebrate, you know, the birthdays of James Joyce, one of the great novelists of this century, or Samuel Beckett, one of the great playrights, we actually celebrate this man.  St Patrick. The man who did what.
All right, don’t diss him.  He did a good job of it, as well.  ‘Cause there’s none there now.  There are none of these in Ireland.  So, he rid Ireland of something.
C’mon, Karl.  Think of something.  Just give us an answer.  What’s -
He ran around on a horse, wackin’ ‘em.
He went on a horse wackin’ ‘em.
Yeah.
What was it, Karl?
What did he rid Ireland of.
Foxes?  I dunno.
Well, no,
No, you’re along the right lines.
Uh,
It was an animal.
Oh!  Bears?
Ricky and Steve chuckle
Yes it was!  Yes, it was bears.
Wow!  It was snakes.
Right.
And there are no snakes in Ireland.
He rid Ireland of all the snakes.
Yeah?
Who did it ‘ere then, ‘cause there aren’t that many.
Well, I think he had a stab at it over here as well, but got tired, went back.
Yeah.
That’s why there’s a few snakes here.  Is it true that there are no snakes in Ireland.
I think it is.  I think it, someone call us, and um,
And what is there, is there any historical evidence for St Patrick? mean, how did he do it – was it like the Pied Piper.
See, I – I – I’m not convinced that he did go around killin’ snakes,
Really?

But there are no snakes in Ireland, yeah.  If someone – someone just uh, we had a few uh, probability experts and statisticians and Maths graduates, confirming that, indeed I was correct, that the probability of 1-6 in a row is no more or less likely than any other single combination, in a totally random selection.  Of balls.  Which brings us back to Hitler, doesn’t it.  ‘Cause he only had one, didn’t he.
Well …
Coming up, we’ll be asking Karl all about Hitler.  The Education of Karl.  He’s done Rasputin, he’s done Che Guevara.
Plus of course, uh, White Van Karl.
White Van Karl.
Where we ask Karl some of the uh, his opinions on some of the hot potatoes of the week.
You learn as you go along,
Yup.
‘Cause that was St Patrick there, and that was thrown in for free, that was an extra,
I’ll learn you somethin’ here.  Snakes –
Well, sorry – can I just stop you there, and I’ll teach you something.  Right?
Go on.  Go on then.
You don’t learn someone something.  You teach them something.
Yep.
It’s not – one’s passive.  You – you learn,
Ricky, I – sorry, mate, but I don’t think you should be teaching a bloke to speak or use grammar.
Ricky laughs
I just don’t think it’s appropriate.
Snakes –
It’s like, it’s embarrassing, frankly.  ‘Cause there’s SO many errors you’re making, it’s like, where to start, with you.
Oh!
Snakes, right, you’re talkin’ about snakes,
Yeah.
A lot of snakes are born with 2 heads.  It’s like a f- it’s like a familiar type thing that happens to snakes.
Ok.
Yeah.  They take it for granted, don’t they!
All right?  Snakes born, 2 heads, they’ll fight each other for food, even though it’s still the same body.
I’nt that weird.
Mm.
Where there kids at school,
Ricky bursts out in laughter
Who had 2 heads –
The snake twins!
Yeah.
From Moseley!
Was it, was, there was kids at your school with 2 heads, is that right?
No – no – they had big heads.
Oh, they had big heads.
And, webbed hands, but they weren’t related, and they – they weren’t friends, ‘cause that would’ve been to obvious, he said.
Yeah.  Yeah.

Oh – oh, Steve – before you came in, right, I sneezed a coupla times, I don’t know if I’m allergic to summat, or I’ve still got a bit of a cold, and I said, Oh God, he went, Bloody hell, I said, Sorry.  And he went, then he went, You know you can’t sneeze with your eyes open, I went, Yeah.  Yeah.  And then he was obviously thinkin’ to himself still, and after a pause, he went, would your eyes really fly out?  And I started laughin’, he went, No, has anyone ever done that, do you think?
Steve laughs

Has anyone ever held someone down, torturin’ ‘em, and held their eyelids open, and gave ‘em pepper, and see if their eyes would fly out.  And he said, and then, and then he went, I – I’m just lookin’ at him again, the silence, and then he went, of his own accord, he just went, I can’t see it happenin’.
Steve laughs
